articles.author: Jonathan Martin and Sheryl Gay Stolberg
articles.title: Roy Moore Is Accused of Sexual Misconduct by a Fifth Woman
articles.description: The new accusations came hours after Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, declared that he believes the accusers and urged Mr. Moore, a Senate candidate, to step aside.

articles.author: Matt Apuzzo and Michael S. Schmidt
articles.title: Trump Judicial Pick Did Not Disclose He Is Married to a White House Lawyer
articles.description: Brett J. Talley was asked to name family members who might be a conflict of interest. He did not mention that his wife is the White House counsel’s chief of staff.

articles.author: Scott Shane, Nicole Perlroth and David E. Sanger
articles.title: Security Breach and Spilled Secrets Have Shaken the N.S.A. to Its Core
articles.description: A serial leak of the agency’s cyberweapons has damaged morale, slowed intelligence operations and resulted in hacking attacks on businesses and civilians worldwide.

articles.author: Choe Sang-Hun
articles.title: North Korean Soldier Shot by Own Troops as He Defects to the South
articles.description: The North Korean was found alive by South Korean troops and taken to a hospital.

articles.author: Sarah Almukhtar, Larry Buchanan, Michael Gold
articles.title: After Weinstein: A List of Men Accused of Sexual Misconduct and the Fallout for Each
articles.description: Since the Harvey Weinstein scandal, a number of high-profile men have resigned, been fired or experienced other fallout after claims of sexual misconduct.

articles.author: Nicholas Fandos, Matt Apuzzo and Charlie Savage
articles.title: Jeff Sessions Displays Unsteady Recall on Trump-Russia Matters
articles.description: Mr. Sessions said he could not recall the details of a campaign adviser’s Russia proposals, but he could recall that he rejected a proposed Trump-Putin meeting.

articles.author: Michael S. Schmidt and Maggie Haberman
articles.title: Justice Dept. to Weigh Inquiry Into Clinton Foundation
articles.description: In a letter to the House Judiciary Committee, the Justice Department said it planned to pursue the possibility of appointing a special counsel to investigate the Uranium One deal.

articles.author: Ekow N. Yankah
articles.title: Opinion | Can My Children Be Friends With White People?
articles.description: The rise of Donald Trump has broken bonds on all sides. But for people of color the stakes are different.

articles.author: Gina Kolata
articles.title: Under New Guidelines, Millions More Americans Will Need to Lower Blood Pressure
articles.description: Experts set new targets for treatment of hypertension on Monday, greatly expanding the number of adults who will qualify for the diagnosis.

articles.author: Nicholas St. Fleur
articles.title: Wine From Prehistoric Georgia With an 8,000-Year-Old Vintage
articles.description: Pottery shards recovered from two archaeological sites in the country are the oldest evidence of winemaking, pushing the date back 600 to 1,000 years.
